Pov3D.display
Class YPoint

java.lang.Object
  Pov3D.util.ProcessingObject
      Pov3D.display.YPoint

public class YPoint
extends ProcessingObject

YPoint is an internal point class that can convert itself from 3D Cartesian representation (i.e. X,Y,Z) to "Slices" / Polar Coordinate System. The Polar System which is the displacement from a central Y Axis (a Centre Column), Theta rotation around that Y Axis, and Height Y from a 0 base plane. Currently this class can only convert from Cartesian to Polar systems

Author:
Brady Marks (furiousgreencloud@gmail.com)

setPol_private

public void setPol_private(int theta,
                           int radius,
                           int height)
Private set function which does the hard work of the converting the last step from Polar coords to slices. Note that the paramters are device specific integers, the reason for this to collapes resolution on the the device specific value.

Parameters:
theta - degrees 0-360, 360 interger degrees is enough resolution for now, since in practice the display will use 80-150 slices.
radius - 0 - 24 the (peggy2 boards have only 25 pixels)
height - 0 - 49 the height of the display is 2 x 25 pixels : 50
